posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

Pic related is a ring laser gyroscope.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ring_laser_gyroscope

RLGs detect rotation via the Sagnac effect.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sagnac_effect

RLGs detect Earth's rotation.
https://www.caltech.edu/about/news/new-chip-based-laser-gyroscope-measures-earths-rotation

inb4
>MUH PHYSICIST MIS-QUOTES!
Because flerfers like to use pilpul to argue endlessly over their misquotes, we'll just cut to the chase and dismiss this as an appeal to authority fallacy.

>MUH ROTATING AETHER!
Michelson-Morley disproved the theory of a luminous aether.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michelson–Morley_experiment

>NOOOOO! THE AETHER IS REALLY THERE!
MM has been repeated with instruments 2 orders of magnitude more sensitive. Still null.

>BUT FRINGES WERE DETECTED! MUH AETHER IS ROTATING!
Fringes are always within the device error range. As devices become more accurate, the fringes become smaller, ultimately by two orders of magnitude. Either the aether is magically slowing its rotation as we build more accurate interferometers...which also means a rotating aether cannot explain RLG results...or there is no aether.

>BUT MUH DEVICE ORIENTATION!
During a MM experiment the device is slowly rotated 360°. The result is a graph, not a single reading. There are no orientation errors due to time.

>BUT MUH AETHER VORTEX MPH VARIES WITH LATITUDE AND ALTITUDE!
But the speed of light does not vary with latitude or altitude, which rules this out entirely.

>BUT MUH ROTATING DOME SHELL INERTIAL FORCES! MUH CORIOLIS FORCE!!!
RLGs do not rely on inertial or Coriolis forces. They rely entirely on Sagnac.

>BUT HAWKING SAID!
Oh, you love Hawking? Good, he said Earth is a rotating sphere orbiting the sun, and even showed people how to prove this.
https://ca.pbslearningmedia.org/resource/hawking_genius_ep06_clip01/where-are-we-ch-1-the-circumference-of-the-earth-genius-by-stephen-hawking/

MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

posts.com:
>>33806643
>How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?
You recognize a "full blown lucid dream" by your mental clarity, not what you're able to do. In full lucid dreams you have the same kind of sharp thinking as in real life, able to fully self-reflect and process thoughts as in waking life. In what you call dreams ibetween it's more like you're a zombie with a vague notion that there are no consequences for your actions.

>>33807184
If you're religious, you might benefit from thinking lucid dreaming is some kind of magic phenomena, since it will make it feel more real. If you want to just DILD, do the boring basic shit like keeping a dream journal, reality checks, and MILD before bed.

posts.com:
well gents, new year new goals. something i wish to take seriously this year is something i've come to call "wake-sleeping", although i suppose a more fitting name might simply be "lucid sleeping".

the concept is quite simple: remain aware whenever the body sleeps. it would certainly be similar to WILD, except it takes place at bed time, and ends when you would normally wake up; the ultimate goal being, to completely and entirely decouple consciousness from sleep. the most advanced form of this practice, theoretically, would result in one who never lapses in consciousness, 24/7 awareness.

i've made some progress on making this work, but it's obviously hard. it is certainly possible, however, and so i remain confident in its feasibility, but the trial and error is long and grueling.

i will keep updates in these threads as meaningful developments occur, as this intersects plainly with lucid dreaming (engaging in this practice successfully would have a side effect of making ALL dreams lucid).

Aries Moon has a kind of malefic effect of making you restless and irrational. We live in a social context where you are not allowed to beat down your enemies or express your rage in the heat of the moment, so this means that it's something you must be mindful to control lest it bring you ruin; but you can imagine how not hesitating to slay those you've deemed a threat to you, or feeling the need to constantly be on the move and searching for something (along with Venus in Sagittarius), could be very useful natural traits to have in other contexts, like a state of nature or the wild west. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33845665
>Thank you for the reading. I feel like I have strong ideals, but am eccentric in my work and pursuits as well.
I am not sure if it is possible to read someone's ideals from a zodiac - maybe some could do it, but I can't. One of the people I deeply admire had very strong Taurus placements and he is the most idealistic person I've ever seen, so it's certainly possible - for a lot of other people, "idealism" is just a word or something they think, but with fixed earth signs like Taurus, idealism means inflexibly adhering to your ideal through the greatest storms and arduously working towards its achievement, come what may. It's an idealism married to determination and hard work.
The red lines are called challenging aspects: squares and oppositions. Aspects are links between planets, excluding co-presence and conjunction, which do not have any lines - you have a ton of planets in co-presence, so only your squares from the 2nd to the 5th house light up.
There's a handful of aspect types: outside of conjunction, there's sextile, trine, square and opposition. The last two are difficult, the middle two are beneficial. Sextiles have a range of 3 houses, squares 4, trines 5, oppositions 7. Your 2nd to 5th house is a range of four, so you have squares between your moon and your 5th house planets. A square is a challenge, but it is not necessarily bad - it causes difficulties that result in events, developments, growth etc. It can produce both good and bad results depending on your actions. These moon squares are the only aspects you'd have from a Hellenistic perspective, which is the perspective I use. They're the better 'negative' aspect to have - oppositions are worse because there's no way to "resolve" them and there is no action generated from them, the only way to deal with them is to strike a balance between the opposing planets. Sextiles and trines refer to either minor or major harmony between the planets involved.
tl;dr planet placements determine aspects

You mean the square aspects? You might be onto something, actually. Keep in mind that I am trying to read your chart in Hellenistic whole sign (even though you posted your chart in Placidus). It is interesting though. You don't quite have a grand cross because the degrees don't quite align, but you do have a sign-based grand cross, I guess. It's all mutable signs too, actually - your only non-mutable placement is Venus in Taurus. Honestly, you could probably get a whole professional reading just on this aspect form.
Honestly, I am not sure where to start with interpreting this because I've never done a grand cross (or a grand cross-like formation) before. I guess the most important things you need to know is that a square is a very energetically intensive placement - conflicts always breeds a lot of movement, and it can lead to powerful feedback loops of growth or destruction, depending on how you direct and control your life. There is definitely a ton of tension, but it can be highly productive tension, if you master it and put it to work for you. The square is the most energetically intense aspect, even if it is adversarial, and can lead to good results just as well as it can lead to bad ones. Here comes in a second concept: overcoming. When planet A has a square with planet B, if B lies on the right side of A, then A overcomes B. If B lies on the left side of A, then A is overcome by B. This is loosely a balance of power issue - without your intervention, the stronger planet prevails and pushes your life in the direction that it chooses.
For you, the houses involved are 3, 6, 9 and 12. I am not sure which house I should begin my examination from, but in any case there's many different interpretations - you might want to look up all the significations of these three houses.
Cont

No such thing as empty houses - they each have signs and you can also consult the house ruler to see what other factors are going to interact with the house topics. At least that's how we do things in whole sign.
For example: you got Venus in the 6th house, but it also rules the 11th house of societies and friends. Consequently, we might suppose that you could join some kind of medical association and make plenty of friends there. Similarly, the sun importing 7th house topics of partnerships into the 2nd house of finance could mean that you become a businessman (two-party contracts) or a professional matchmaker. (Or a pimp? LOL.)
I guess a super quick rundown of your chart might be that romance is super important to you (Sun in 7th) and that you're after serious, mature girls (Sun in Capricorn). Ascendant ruler in 12th might mean grappling with enemies (possibly women since the moon is in the 12th) or mental illness. Gemini moon also means being good at languages. 9th house Saturn might mean problems with education, like becoming a dropout. Or religious problems. Mars in 3rd might mean problems with practical activity.

https://alwaysasking.com/why-does-anything-exist/#Defining_Nothing

>What is nothing? It seems like a straightforward question. Just keep removing things until there is nothing left.

>Start with the universe as it is. Wipe away all the matter and energy. Take away all the quantum fields of the vacuum, and any virtual particles popping in and out of existence. And voilà: nothingness.

>But wait, there’s still space. It still has dimensionality, and curvature. There is still time and physical law, even if there are no particles or fields left to be governed by them. Let us delete those too.

>Let’s erase the volume of space, erase time, and erase physical law.

>What are we left with? If we eliminate all the dimensions of space and time, we’re left with a zero-dimensional, changeless point.

>But a point is still a thing. Can we delete that too?

>So long as we operate from a theory of geometry, we can’t define nothingness as anything less than a space of zero-dimensionality.

>This leaves us with a point.

>If we want to eliminate the point, we need to define nothingness not as a space of zero dimensionality, but as something non-geometric. For this, we must define nothingness in terms of some other theory.

>But any theory we might choose has its own notion of nothing. In other words, nothingness is theory-dependent.

>There is an unlimited number of possible theoretical systems. Does this mean there are also unlimited conceptions of nothing?

>Might there be a true nothing — one with no laws, principles, nor any theory behind it? Or might every conception of nothing require a theory of things in order to declare that there are none of them?

>Wheeler called for absolute nothingness: “neither structure, nor law, nor plan.” But is this kind of absolute nothing achievable?

>>33847977
https://youtu.be/W2u5nfnxWyU
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bedlam_in_Goliath
>On a trip in Jerusalem, Rodriguez-Lopez purchased an archaic ouija-type talking board at a curio shop as a gift for Bixler-Zavala. They would return to their tour bus after shows to play with it during their 2006 tour with the Red Hot Chili Peppers, as it quickly became the band's post-show ritual. Dubbed "The Soothsayer", the board revealed stories, gave names and made demands, as the band was contacted by three different people who appeared in the form of one, who was then referred to as "Goliath". The more the band interacted with "The Soothsayer", otherworldly coincidences began plaguing the band's experience writing and recording The Bedlam in Goliath: Blake Fleming, their drummer at the time, quit mid-tour and left the band with financial troubles; Bixler-Zavala wound up needing surgery performed on his foot due to the shoes he had been wearing, forcing him to relearn how to walk post-surgery; audio tracks sporadically disappeared from the studio's harddrives; Rodriguez-Lopez's home studio flooded and was subject to multiple power outages; and the album's original engineer went through a nervous breakdown, leaving behind all previous work with no notes as to where anything was. The engineer who quit stated to Rodriguez-Lopez: "I'm not going to help you make this record. You're trying to do something very bad with this record, you're trying to make me crazy and you're trying to make people crazy."

Rodriguez-Lopez was on the brink of starting the recording from scratch. Midway through the recording sessions, Rodriguez-Lopez broke "The Soothsayer" in half and buried it in an undisclosed location as an attempt to undo the curse and halt the unforeseen tragedies. Rodriguez-Lopez swore never to give away the location of the burial, and also asked the band not to speak of it again during the remainder of the album's production.

>>33839173
>any advice on breaking through the stage im stuck on
Most powerful technique is to manipulate your subconscious mind through denial of desires. For example, make it a point that you'll eat no more food until you astral project, once you finally AP you can eat again. You could also do this with sexual gratification, internet, water, anything that has powerful urges connected to it, you deny that desire and tell yourself the only way to get what you want is to astral project. The point is creating as much stress as possible within the subconscious, resulting in powerful subconscious motivation to AP, which is especially important because it's highly probable that right now you're subconsciously resistant to AP.

What techniques you use in combination with this isn't super important, it's only important that you practice them as often as possible. What's most likely going to happen is you're going to fall asleep at some point during this process and your subconscious will do the work for you, you'll wake up right into the mind awake body asleep/vibratory stage and that's when the work you've put towards practicing separation will be most useful

>>33820441
Body asleep, mind awake.

Lay down, almost like you're about to fall asleep. Get into to a comfortable position. Next, close your eyes and keep your mind awake while your body drifts asleep.

The key part about keeping your mind awake is this: it doesn't mean staying alert. Body asleep. Mind awake. Sit back, and relax. Don't think too hard, let thoughts come to you. You will be laying down on your bed, and the thoughts will come to you bubbling into your mind. Let them grow. Look at them, focus on them. Eventually, images, and sounds will form. Peer into those. Walk into it, as if you were walking with your body.

And there you have it!

>>33848287
My understanding was that's it a bit different for everyone, but for me it was like this:

Endless darkness with a sort of 'glow' that came from everywhere and nowhere.
Writing bodies contorting in every way, covered in excrement.
Screams of agony and moans of pleasure that were deafening.
The horrifying stink of decay was inescapable.

Every conceivable horror played out before me, and eventually I was forced to join in on the endless debasement of everything. While soul-crushing darkness hid the true scope of it, it was clear that there would be no limit to this suffering. As horror beyond horror played out before me, I was eventually forced to join in. I was forced to watch myself be both victim and perpetrator, and I won't ever speak the things I was forced to do. I will say that the worst, absolute most egregious and despicable violation was actually the end of it all. Because by the end, I was made to understand that -anyone- who was dragged to this place could eventually be 'ok' with things. That notion was a haunting realization but at the same time the greatest relief, in a sick and vile way, because it meant that all of the bad would begin to feel good and that was the only way to keep yourself a shred of sanity.

I've said this before and I'll say it again, don't go to that place if you can avoid it. Don't ask to be shown those things, just take my word for it. I'm glad I was able to see it without breaking my will but I felt like I only barely clung to sanity after just a few hours there. As far as I'm concerned, I will carry the taint of that experience with me to my grave. While I can keep the corruption at bay, knowing that it's there to stay took some time to integrate. I feel like it's made me stronger some how, like I've been inoculated against evil (spiritually vaxxed, lol), but god damn did that suck ass.

•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.

•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

I pulled a lot of cards since I read for a few diff situations and I read my pulls like a storybook of sorts.

>two of swords - eight of pents - the fool - ten of swords - four of cups rx - five of swords rx - temperance - nine of cups - queen of wands - six of swords rx - page of swords - two of cups - the sun - page of cups rx - three of pents - justice rx - ten of wands

This is just a passing connection, as painful as it may be. Passing connections teach us life lessons, and it seems as if this one was to teach you that you need to respect yourself first and foremost in the face of unfair treatment. You cannot accept it when people treat you selfishly. There are many people out there in the world, you don't need to keep focusing on a connection that is a clear dead end.

However, it doesn't feel as if your story with A is over just yet. A does still think of you, A does have regrets and has been mulling over the situation and would like to reach out and talk again. A misses you in a romantic context and will try to sell himself to you and tell you why he would be great to take back, but make no mistake, this is also driven by selfish desires. You'll accept him back into your life, but you won't trust him as a romantic partner, you'll try to keep a strictly platonic relationship, and this works in your favor because he will try to coerce you and may act a little nasty when he doesn't get his way. This too, will be a lesson in self respect. He does not respect you, and at times may even view you as a dramatic, emotional women, as men often do.

The first encounter is the pain. Right now is your healing period. The second encounter is where these lessons learned come into action and you learn how to assert yourself against unfair treatment.

8 of clouds : guilt

Sin is one of the most negative emotions we have. If we did something else wrong or went against our conscience, then, of course, we would feel terrible. But letting yourself be overwhelmed with guilt feelings means you have invited a migraine. We are surrounded by persistent clouds of self-doubt and feelings of worthlessness to the point where we cannot see any of the beautiful and joyful surroundings that life gives us.
We all seek to be better – love more, be more aware, be more real to ourselves. But when we punish ourselves for our failures by feeling guilty, we can be locked into a cycle of despair and hopelessness about ourselves and the circumstances we are in. You are absolutely okay as you are, and it is absolutely natural to go astray from time to time. Just learn from it, move on, and use those lessons not to make the same mistake again.

Mine is that it's all about consciousness. When you look at everything in the world through the lens of what's within you (be aware of how everything makes you feel) it starts to look like everything is designed to control your consciousness.
Both "good" and "evil" are controlling. Even "good" isn't good enough because it's always having to fight back against evil and never gets to rest.
Neither feels right to my soul.

My hypothesis is that it's all a show. It's all like a dance that needs you to accept and believe it all for it to keep going.
And the real line is not between good and evil but between being in control of your own consciousness or having it be controlled by illusions.
And any philosophy or religion that teaches acceptance of the world is, in my opinion, trying to keep you trapped. Acceptance can either come as fear (i.e. hell) or even love. Both are tools being used by the system to control us.

I realized long ago that if I exist in a reality where it's literally impossible to know what truth is, then the only thing I can truly trust is myself (what's within me). Why bet on anything else?
Sometimes I think that's the entire point of all this. That there is a higher purpose to it all, and it's to teach us to stop looking for answers outside of ourselves, to stop giving our power away by believing the answer is somewhere else.

I do think Jesus was legit (especially in the gospel of thomas), but I think his true teachings were quite different from the bible in general, and that Hell is a complete lie. The idea of hell being "eternal torment" was a mistranslation of "eternal death" anyway.
Hell doesn't make any sense no matter how you slice it. As a form of "punishment" it's complete nonsense because the only purpose of punishment is to teach a lesson. There's literally no point at all in a punishment that never ends. It's just an idea used to control you through fear.

Horse Stance (picrel): The practioner stands in such a manner where qi is locked into their dantian and they can recieve an equal amount of terrestrial and heavenly qi. Qigong/Tai Chi: Exercises to cultivate the inner energy through a series of movements meant to represent the microcosmical phases of nature, there are many different forms of this but all of them involve some form of movement and exercise to cultivate energy.
Qi Meditation: This is a bit more complex however the general idea is that the practioner must build psychic awareness to the point they can visualize their meridian network, once this is accomplished you circulate qi through the meridians and the which raises the level of qi.
When looking for information on these subjects view everything with a skeptic eye.

First, the cleansing of your meridians/chakra/space veins or whatever you want to call them seems to provide a noticeable improvement to your body. Probably improves circulation and balances hormones and other gland type stuff, possible as a side effect of the brain being able to put more of it's resources towards your body due to the de-stressing. Second, storing energy in your body feels like it's actually working as advertised, and my energy levels and mental clarity has been much more stable over the day than before. For example, it's no longer difficult to get up and do dishes after getting home from work, because I feel just as energized at home as I do at work.

Read about this shit in a bunch of silly fantasy books, tried it out irl and found that its actually pretty legit. I want to learn some of the kung fu that goes a long with chi work, but I don't think I ever will have the opportunity in a traditional sense. I'm still just happy that this stuff is working well.

If you want to know about chi based fighting, check out snake style kung fu. While there are elements of using your chi as a weapon, snake style is largely about tapping in to chi to enhance your reflexes to a level of near-precognition and achieving a hypersensitive state of mind.

>Hung Gar
Don't make me laugh. Next you will be telling me how devastating your Wing Chun is.
The real Chinese masters are from Taiwan now. This is because they were persecuted by the CCP, and had to flee mainland China. Maybe some of them ended up in Hong Kong, but the best all went to Taiwan.
There are some valuable principles in the internal arts but it is not the woo woo people here think it is. The term "internal" is referring to the internal muscles of the body, rather than the muscles of the limbs. It is a gross misunderstanding of Chinese language and philosophy to interpret these things as supernatural abilities. However, I found the Chinese way of describing and training these principles very helpful. The brief lessons I had with a legit internal arts instructor gave me an understanding of several principles that I applied to my own arts. One thing I noticed right away about Chinese internal arts, is that they are very well thought out training methods designed to give you as much ability as possible without damaging your body. They will never defeat someone like Tyson or a great muay thai fighter, but they won't be brain damaged or crippled by 50 either. They will also absolutely wreck an untrained street punk.
There are no magic secrets, Anons. Fighting takes a LOT of hard work, and to be a champion you will ultimately have to destroy yourself. There is nothing on this planet that will make a 98 pound weakling able to defeat a heavyweight MMA champion, empty handed. Fill your hand with steel, well that's a different story, and where all of that "size does not matter" bullshit comes from.

posts.name: Anonymous

I learned many of the same principles I have seen a legit systema coach teach, from a legit internal martial arts master from Taiwan. As for eating Cro cop kicks, there were a lot of fixed fights in pride, and those kicks, while very powerful, were not necessarily the fight enders you were led to believe they were. All of this stuff is a lot easier to understand once you get to an intermediate or higher level in any martial art that involves actual sparring and competition. It all boils down to good old fashioned hard work and practice.

>>33833076
no, there is overwhelming and clear evidence of advanced precision machining at megalithic sites. If they used the method you describe that evidence would not exist.

Examples of that evidence include machining marks left behind in tubular bore holes, circular saw marks suggesting powered diamond-tipped saw blades with a diameter of tens of feet, micron and sub micron precision cuts in various stone blocks, perfectly cut granite jars that look to have been made with a powered lathe (including one example showing evidence of starting in the wrong axis, stopping, realigning the work, and continuing), and much more.

These are processes and levels of precision only found in modern CNC machine tools using modern materials like diamond tipped cutters. Some of the cuts seen such as the tubular drill hole marking even exceeds the performance of any modern tools. Christopher Dunn made a mold of one such tube hole and its corresponding plug in a granite block in egypt, and published his findings including the angle of the cut. He clearly showed that it was a continuous tool mark and that whatever tool made the marking had managed to cut several inches into the granite with just a few rotations of the tool. Making such a deep cut in so few rotations in a material as hard as granite is quite literally impossible for even our best tools using diamond cutting surfaces. He speculated about what kind of process could be used to achieve such a cut and thought that something using resonant frequencies to weaken the material while cutting could have been used. Machining of this type does exist today, but its usually used for machining very hard and brittle materials like cast iron. As far as i know there are no examples of this being done with granite, although it might be possible.

There are other things which I could get into but its a very vast topic. Even just the structure of those megalithic sites, with the perfectly interlocking stones (in 3 dimensions) is insane.

The softening is achieved by applying pressure to the rock, then quickly moving it (quick acceleration). The material of granite is not fully solid and doing this process enough times will soften the rock.

You can try this phenomenon for example by softly biting you pinky finger while applying pressure to your fingernail for about 30 seconds then quickly form a fist with your hand or throw a punch. You will notice that your fingernail gets a little soft after doing that.

>>33848043
The thing with Sagittarius is that it's been heavily stereotyped in a way that's divorced from real life Sagittarians. For some reason, it and Jupiter have been deemed entities of great wisdom and mental power, in such a way you'd think they'd be genius sages on average.

In real life, Sagittarius energy is borderline ADD and dilettante-ish if in any way intellectual, just being a flaneur who enjoys new experiences thoroughly and has an insatiable need for good and high vibes. Fire signs aren't necessarily dumb, but they're not intellectuals. Sagittarius intellectualism is simplistic stuff like "Be like water, my friend" (Bruce Lee, Sagittarius). They are more likely to be athletes of some sort than philosophers, because they have a lot of energy to expend and seek out ever more ways to expend and replenish it. It just happens that some of the energy spills out into the mind and makes for curious people who like to figure things out from time to time.

Sagittarius is one of the least analyzed because it's one of the most complicated, but it's partially one of the most complicated in large part because the common conception that's been established is highly fractured and somewhat contradictory.

I find Aquarius to suffer the same fate. That also has been romanticized in such a way that it's become divorced from the whole, actual truth.

I still don't understand what happened yesterday if I try to interpet it spiritually, but I don't mind. Since I confronted her with unconditional love, there have been no intrusive thoughts, nor thoughts disappearing or being disrupted, and my emotions are stable and positive. Even when it comes to my physical vision, it's like the colours are jumping out at me, and I feel too mesmerised just by that alone to be bothered by anything. I feel carefree, in heavy contrast with a few days ago, when I felt overwhelmed by fear, and lost control over my thoughts several times, often feeling compelled to erase my expressions of frightening thoughts.

I recall how much less mentally stable I became, after my trauma resurfaced 1.5 months ago; as well as what I went through 2.5 years ago, which would've seemed like a psychotic break to anyone, if I hadn't isolated myself from all the people I knew (even family) to the extent that I did at the time. (I'm still grateful to my fiancé for helping remember who I am after I regained control of my mind back then; I felt so lost, and my personality was completely different for a while.) And it makes me think; had my condition continued to worsen, would my personality once again have shifted to something unrecognisable, like it did 2.5 years ago? Did my actions yesterday, where I let go of something with love and tears, prevent something of such a magnitude?

It all seems to be tied to trauma. "If only I could understand," I think; but is this really a case where understanding would help? Sometimes it just takes time to heal, and perhaps I'll never fully heal in this lifetime. And that's okay. Because I'll always try to make the best of it, and be there for my family and partner. With their help, I can live a fulfilling life; and by spending it with them, I'll fulfil them too.

I'm glad I was born.

posts.com:
We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

I've posted a thread like this before a long time ago, I've discovered an extremely simple and easy cure for nausea that takes literal seconds to do. It doesn't remove the feeling of nausea, instead it makes the feeling matter only as much as maybe someone lightly pinching you, so basically not at all.

The key is awareness. Nausea is not even that unpleasant, it's below almost all other negative feelings. When you're feeling nauseous you don't feel bad because of the nausea, you feel bad because your monkey brain panics and amplifies all negative feelings, partially as a warning to not do whatever you did again and partially to prepare you for vomiting.

When you relax and remain aware of this fact nausea is nothing, it is a low-level feeling that even minor pains like somebody pinching you will be more irritating. Analyze ALL feelings you are having, be completely aware of them, and you'll see that it's all hype, there is literally nothing there under the screen of
>I feel like I'm going to die, this is horrible, Muh PAIN!
Actually be aware of the feelings and realize that nausea isn't some strong feeling, instead it causes fear and panic in your primitive brain in order to punish you and get you away from other people. When I calm myself and get rid of the panic I'm left with some minor pains usually that go along with it and no other negative feelings or thoughts, and minor pains are easy to handle. For pains too bad I use pain relief music, it really does work as long as you relax and let it. "Fighting pain" works short-term, long-term you accept pain and allow it to pass harmlessly, it's like nausea's bigger brother.

With the use of this technique nausea literally doesn't matter to me, I will sit there with a vomit bucket and just be watching TV or youtube completely unaffected. You still vomit and everything but it literally doesn't matter. There is even a rush of "panic endorphins" that can turn the whole feeling mildly euphoric depending on pain level.

The advantage of anisogamy is one gamete can invest in nutrient retention and resources (the egg) and the other can specialize in motility to get to the bigger sex cell with the pre-packaged nutrients (the sperm).

Parthenogenesis came after the evolution of eggs and sperm. Usually, parthenogenesis is used in conjunction with sexual reproduction. posts.com:
This may be quite controversial, but doesn't it make the most sense that real "love" is not a feeling at all.
And that feeling nothing is "love"?

Basically what I'm getting at is that it's supposed to be the neutral state of things. It should either feel like nothing or something like "freedom".
It should be a feeling of being unconstrained, but that should also feel like nothing.
Things like "love" and "freedom" only feel like something when you're living in a negative world, because the world tries to make you think those are not neutral states. Like they have to be earned or something (which is unloving and unfree).

I know the idea of "feeling nothing" can sound cold, but just put that aside for a moment (because I think it's caused by confusion about the way the world works).
If you really think about it, the feeling of "nothing" is the feeling of just letting everyone be themselves. It's only when you want people to be something other than what they are that you start to have feelings typically called love, lust, or hate. Most of the normal kinds of "love" come from some feeling of incompleteness within someone. Like an unhealthy need or attachment. Or to fill a hole inside oneself.

For example, if someone is "evil" and you feel nothing then that "nothing" is like you allowing them to just be who they are. What's more loving than that? That's literally the definition of unconditional love.
Why should you require a burning passionate feeling in your heart to want to let people be themselves? The very idea that feeling something is required to have a world like that is actually kind of oppressive isn't it?

Wanting people to be themselves, and enjoying a reality where each soul is allowed to be their own unique expression is just normal (but of course it's not normal in THIS world so that's why it feels like something here).

>>33848290
I'd suggest that everyone who meditates or wants to start meditating to ask himself the question: Why am I meditating/Why I want to meditate?
So yeah, ask yourself that question.

Ask yourself: Why I want to open my chakras or manipulate energy?

I'm suggesting this because people get into meditation to either chase illusions and other ego-stuff (like goals) or to try and escape from illusions (fears, trauma etc), I think that this is wrong and that meditation should be used for the exact opposite: To realize that all of that are illusions and nothing more.

I'd suggest to just sit and be aware of your body sensations, of your body being there and breathing, not analyzing it or controlling it but totally letting it go and just watching it. This is the basis of the meditative state: Being aware.

But don't put words into it, don't make goals, just do it everyday and stay there.
Depending on who you are this may take some time.

And lastly to also answer your question: You "open chakras" by focusing on them, yeah, meditation is a physical practice not a mental one, you sit to sense and feel so just sit and feel the chakras.

However I'd suggest that first you sit to silence the mind by being still and aware.
Good luck.

>>33853173
There is no division between mindfulness and meditation. Mindfulness is a word that was taken from western spiritual traditions to translate the word "Sati", and it was re-adopted by western society for largely marketing purposes. It's a cozy word. Really, meditation (samadhi) is a focused application of mindfulness (sati). There is no meditation without mindfulness; samma samadhi is the result of samma sati. The Satipatthana sutta is the frame within which all other meditation methods occur in. To be mindful is to keep something in mind, and in Buddhism that's within the framework of the four satipatthana.

I haven't been trained in Zen but I have experience serving retreats at Thai Forest monasteries, where I did read some books on Zazen... the gist I got was that we "just sit to sit" or "sitting is good for nothing". While I can't say how accurate my understanding is, I think this is helpful for times when you get too caught up in goals to the point where you're stressing yourself out, in which case it may be wise to just get back to the bare bones: sitting. But doing that for a while, your mind gets a bit listless or confused, in which case it's helpful to remember why you're practicing in the first place. But sometimes to go deep you have to put aside the part of the mind which is constructing goals and reasons for focusing attention. In a way you have to "just do it". Think Solid Snake in Metal Gear Solid: "Don't think, shoot!"

But in any case, there is mindfulness: remembering to "just sit" or remembering the 16 steps of Anapanasati. You need to read your own mind, so to speak, to see what's good for you. But mindfulness is always there until the end. Sometimes we just get too self conscious about it (which is what the mindfulness industry seems to profit off of).

As the other anon said: Don't make up many goals, just sit to watch and be aware, that's it. When you get to the point of being more aware and your mind slows down with its overthinking then you will be taken to deeper places of understanding.

Don't even think "Now I am doing mindfulness and not concentration", don't analyze things much, just sit for at least 40 mins, even an hour if you can everyday and focus on your breath, yes your mind will create many things but don't give them much attention just return to the breath and be aware of the sensations of your body.

Your body is the grounding place, you probably need to be grounded first like most people nowadays, I'd suggest that you reduce recreational screen time (video games, series e.t.c.) and try to feel your body most of the day instead, remember to FEEL your body not think about feeling your body.

posts.com: I personally believes they were mostly highly divided, isolationist and elitist city states that held an iron grip over the little territories they directly controlled, with the inland areas being populated by savages and uncultured (by the standards of aforementioned city states) tribes. So when the "flood"/rising sea level came about, almost all the coastal citt states cultures were forced into the highlands, where their cultural tradition dictated their interaction with the local tribals, whence the ones that survives the ordeal integrated into said tribes due to low population, some mingling with the tribals while others asserted themselves as the ruling authority, either via force or intellectual might. Henceforth they became the ancestor of pre-bronze era cultures, with the inherited tradition acting as base for the new cultures and social structure, with royal lines tracing their lineages to the pre-flood civs royal lines as per tradition. But due to the precarity of their situation and the openness of the new territories compared to coastal waters, they couldn't truly control the coming and going of their subject tribes, which eventually resulted in their intermingling with tribal elites as to assert their authority, eventually resulting in their dissapearance as their ethnic traits became more and more diluted until nothing remained but the traditions and claims.

According to Dr. Jacobs (in Walking Among Us) the mantids appear in far too many abduction stories to be ignored, and they're consistently seen as being in charge of the subservient greys, and sometimes reptilians who are rarely seen working with them.

Hi /x/, throughout my life I had have experience paranormal activities that are curiously related to sleep. Waking up, realizing I'm levitating only to fall squarely into bed, seeing a jumping shadow coming down the stairs of my house just to move things in the kitchen, dreaming daily and being able to remember almost all my dreams, and then what just happened to me recently.

A few days ago, because I had gotten up too early, I went to bed in the morning and took the opportunity to meditate for a while while the sun finished rising completely. I was completely covered by my sheets and with my eyes completely closed. Shortly after my mother got up and went to my room to get some things out of the closet. Even though I was with my sheets covering me, with my eyes closed, and turning to the opposite side from where she was, I could clearly see her silhouette moving and taking the things she was holding, monochromatically as the figure is projected in my head.
At first it seemed strange to me, but I didn't pay much attention to it. It wasn't until the image changed position into my bedroom door that I realized I was truly seeing what was happening around me. I saw my cat come in and stand near my bed. I didn't hear any footsteps, and I wasn't sure if what I was seeing was real.
Even if the question seemed silly, I took the opportunity that my mother was still in the room to ask her if the cat was where I told her, and surprisingly, I was right.

I searched over the internet to see if there are people who had experience the same situation as me or if it has a name of some kind.
The only thing I could find related to this was the "Third eye", but I'm not completely satisfied with that answer.

>be me as a kid

>large building made of stained wood with large, rectangular windows
>architecture is weird mix of abstract modernism, very asymmetrical and uncomfortable to look at
>enter building and am met with very long hallway
>as we're walking down the hallway I can see the parking lot just outside the window to my left
>reach end of hallway and turn right into antechamber which connects to yet another absurdly long hallway, running parallel to first one, junction seems to serve no purpose
>sparsely decorated save for the odd fern and the grey carpeting which muted our footsteps
>reach end of second hallway and turn left into second antechamber
>leads into small, L-shaped hallway with a single, small window and cream-colored walls that contrasted with the stained wood up until that point
>turn right and I'm faced with open door with a pitch black room beyond
>what little light trickles in from the hallway illumantes what appears to be endless rows of gurneys, each with a single occupant in a hospital gown
>they are attended by nurses in dated-looking attire, think 50's
>the nurses attend to needs the patients don't appear to have
>none of the gurneys have anything except for the patient, yet the nurses check nonexistent IVs and moniters
>some of the people in the gurneys look familiar, even some family members

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
CBR Proves Earth's Motion Through Space

The ability to measure the cosmic background radiation (CBR) gives us something the physicists of the early/mid 20th century could only dream of: a universal frame of reference by which to establish if Earth is really moving linearly or if it just appears to be. The CBR permeates all of space. If an object is at rest relative to the CBR then the frequencies observed will be the same in all directions. If an object is moving relative to the CBR, then Doppler shift will reveal in what direction and how fast.

We measured this phenomenon and established Earth's linear motion through space using the COBE satellite in operation from 1989 to 1993. What did we find? That the Earth is definitely moving through the cosmos.

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-fast-is-the-earth-mov/

>In 1989, the COBE satellite was placed in orbit about the earth (again, the earth is the frame of reference!) to measure the long-diluted radiation echo of the birth of our universe. This radiation, which remains from the immensely hot and dense primordial fireball that was our early universe, is known as the cosmic microwave background radiation (CBR). The CBR presently pervades all of space. It is the equivalent of the entire universe "glowing with heat."
>One of COBE's discoveries was that the earth was moving with respect to this CBR with a well-defined speed and direction. Because the CBR permeates all space, we can finally answer the original question fully, using the CBR as the frame of reference.
>The earth is moving with respect to the CBR at a speed of 390 kilometers per second. We can also specify the direction relative to the CBR. It is more fun, though, to look up into the night sky and find the constellation known as Leo (the Lion). The earth is moving toward Leo at the dizzying speed of 390 kilometers per second.

>>33852050
The Airy telescope is a mechanical telescope that was invented by British astronomer George Biddell Airy in the 19th century. It was used to measure stellar parallax, a phenomenon in which stars appear to move due to the Earth's rotation around its axis. The measurement of stellar parallax provided a CRUCIAL TEST OF EARTH'S ROTATION, for if the Earth were not rotating, there would be no stellar parallax to measure.

Airy's telescope was designed to measure stellar parallax with unprecedented precision. He used a corrective lens called an "Airy lens" to minimize chromatic and spatial aberrations in images. The telescope also used a micrometer to accurately measure the position of the stars in the images. The results obtained with this telescope provided CONCLUSIVE EVIDENCE FOR THE ROTATION OF THE EARTH, and helped to establish Copernicus's heliocentric theory as an accepted scientific model.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33852050
Michelson linear devices are a type of interferometer that use two mirrors to split and recombine a light beam into two branches, and then measure the interference between these branches. This device was designed and built by the American physicist Albert Michelson in 1881 to measure the speed of light in air and in a vacuum. The Michelson-Morley experiment, as it is commonly known, was designed to measure any differences in the speed of light in different directions in space, specifically to search for the existence of the luminiferous aether, a hypothetical medium thought to fill space. and allowed the propagation of light. However, the experiment did not find any difference in the speed of light in different directions, which led to the conclusion that the ether did not exist. The results of the experiment also played an important role in the formulation of Albert Einstein's theory of special relativity.

From wikipedia (a rough description of events)
On the evening of August 21, 1955, five adults and seven children arrived at the Hopkinsville police station claiming that small alien creatures from a spaceship were attacking their farmhouse, and that they had been holding them off with gunfire "for nearly four hours". Two of the adults, Elmer Sutton and Billy Ray Taylor, claimed they had been shooting at "twelve to fifteen" short, dark figures who repeatedly popped up at the doorway or peered into the windows.[1][2]

Concerned about a possible gun battle between local citizens, four city police, five state troopers, three deputy sheriffs, and four military police from the nearby US Army Fort Campbell drove to the Sutton farmhouse located near the town of Kelly in Christian County. Their search yielded nothing apart from evidence of gunfire and holes in window and door screens made by firearms.[1][3]

Residents of the farmhouse included Glennie Lankford, her children, Lonnie, Charlton, and Mary, two sons from a previous marriage, Elmer "Lucky" Sutton, John Charley "J.C." Sutton, their respective wives Vera and Alene, Alene's brother O.P. Baker, and Billy Ray Taylor and his wife June. Both the Taylors, "Lucky", and Vera Sutton were reportedly itinerant carnival workers who were visiting the farmhouse. The next day, neighbors told two officers that the families had "packed up and left" after claiming "the creatures had returned about 3:30 in the morning".

A lot of thoughts run through one’s mind in a day, some are new, some old. Some good, some bad. The question should be, how do I overcome being tethered to my thinking patterns?

It is personalized for each individual, the mental patterns of thought, ability to generate images etcetera. If you can separate the thoughts generated by the mind, and the internal voice, you can begin to hear the truth of your own situation. To look at it from a different, literally third perspective.

Technically, for each of us, we have 2 distinct voices. One is divided, one is unified. The mind works in divisions, but the heart which is your “second voice” or sight, is absolute - without divisions.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
How to escape the matrix

1. Desire to overcome the world, have a vision to do so
2. In following the light, find the courage to act spontaneously
3. Seek to overthrow the world. In doing so, find love and companionship in others with a similar desire
4. Realize the futility of ego. Realize the truth of each moment/of consciousness, and come to trust completely in yourself
5. Reach 'the wall', an agent. An opponent who cannot be overcome by any means.

After which, you may not have the courage to proceed. But if you do, or if you eventually find that courage, you will face this enemy head-on. Realize their power as your own, and using it, you will reach the real world. In my own experience, it felt a little like: realizing that someone is watching me and affecting me within my own mind/head/body. Realizing the peculiarity of how such a common occurrence shatters the entire matrix of thought which comprises this whole world. Realizing that I too must have this power. Using this power to reach the source of the gazing, and also using this power to see myself as they saw me. When I saw myself, I realized that I was in 2 positions in space/time and yet I was 1. This drew me to the truth, and out of hell.

I thought they're created when a human engages in cannibalism.
This led me to have a thought, where is the line drawn?
If you enter someone else's dusty house, and just walk around a while, you're committing cannibalism. Dust in the air is comprised of skin cells. By existing in their house, some of the dust and therefore their skin will get in your mouth and nose, the mucous it gets stuck in will go to your stomach. Cannibalism. Nobody turns into a skinwalker from breathing dust. What if you excise a piece of someone's epidermis with a scalpel and eat it?
What if you take a chunk of their muscle meat and dehydrate it in an oven, then grind it into a fine powder with a coffee grinder, and vape their remains? Or make a tea out of it?

Moreover, does the context of the cannibalistic act matter? i.e. desperation vs sadism? Lost at in the mountains with a couple other survivors after a plane crash vs a serial killer eating their victims for kicks?
Why don't known cannibals from both sides turn into skin walkers? They seem to just remain human merely because they are known to the public to have engaged in cannibalism.
What if you eat a part of your self? There was a story of a diabetic guy who had his foot amputated, so he took it and turned it into tacos which he and his friends ate consentually. None of them are skinwalkers.

Perhaps location matters. Two identical, unknown people, in the same situation, ceterus peribus, the only difference is one is in/around the rockies or new mexico, and the other is in like britain or some shit. Would the british cannibal remain human while the one in the location relevant to skinwalker folklore be subject to transformation by merit of the soil on which he stands?

Can they be killed? If so, how? Is it a metal stake through the heart? White ash imbued weapons? These are predicated on traditional weaponry, what about fire? Can you incinerate a skinwalker?
